intro: Teclea pilosa, commonly known as the hairy teclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Teclea pilosa produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in woodland and scrub habitats, thriving in warm and humid conditions.
